column1:
Odeinoichus,"2017-08-23T17:41:28.25Z","Fairly Typical of Introductory Packs","

Set #5004388 Nexo Knights Intro Pack: LEGO has introduced the Nexo Knights, and free with any purchase at the beginning of this year is this polybag. Obsessive fans of Polybags will get this because it’s a Polybag, but are the contents worth grabbing this if you aren’t interested in the new Theme? Read on to find out.
Pros:

column2: Free with any purchase from LEGO and LEGO Shop&Home.
Includes two sticker sheets, one Nexo Knights Poster, a Minifigure and a strange Shield accessory, not a keychain, but some kind of bag hanger or something.
Minifigure is impressively detailed, showing the same qualities as those found in Legends of Chima, with double-sided torso, fairly detailed leg printing and a double-sided face.

column1: Cons:

column2: Minifigure lacks accessories for battling against Nexo Knights and is not unique.
Contents of Polybag fail to include any decent builds, would have been nice to see a micro-build of one of the vehicles or the Fortrex similar to other Polybags of this sort in the past.
Shield Dangler seems uninspired, also does not include a Nexo Power.

column1: Overall opinion

I can’t really say this is a bad thing, it accomplishes what it sets out to do, the children receive some nice stickers to apply anywhere they’d like, the poster shows some impressive artwork on both sides and it isn’t in short supply, I’ve gotten three of them from LEGO in the past two months alone. Also it is free, and free means that as far as the price is concerned it can’t be beat.

I feel however that LEGO missed the mark when it comes to the contents of the bag, the stickers and poster are fine, they offer a bit of play value and display options for a child’s bedroom. What I don’t like is the choice of content when it comes to bricks. The Minifigure works fine, but he has no accessories and there’s nothing to really build here. I would have much preferred to see micro-scaled models, keep the Minifigure if possible, maybe add a small weapons rack with swords and such plus a micro-scale vehicle. As a promotional item I’d say it’s fine, accept it and enjoy, if you’re trying to get one on the secondary market because you missed out on it, it’s safe to skip it. The Minifigure isn’t unique and I don’t see a high demand for stickers, backpack danglers or posters.
